mdRecord.dcterms:title: Map of the James River ore belt / drawn by W.G. Williamson, C.E., from notes furnished by Col. M. McDonald
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Williamson, W. G.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Covers the James River Valley beginning at Archers Creek in Campbell County and continuing east through Appomattox County to Bent Creek.

Appeared in: Semi-annual report of the Superintendent of the Virginia Military Institute, enclosing the report of a geological and mineral examination of a portion of the James River iron-belt / by M. McDonald, Professor of Geology. Richmond : R.E. Frayser, Supt. Public Print., 1879.
A reduced size version appeared in The Virginias, v. 1, no. 1, Jan. 1880, under title "Map of iron ore belt on James River below Lynchburg" -- Cf. Swem, Maps relating to Virginia, no. 1370.
